ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] How to read a seed.txt using JMX on Heritrix 2?
ygData.msgSnippet: I think you re approaching this the right way: the web UI does use JMX to update the seeds file, either locally or to a remote engine, so what you want to do

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=JbzCcaj37JWU6Meb5xN_TTbps7vokSiTISnSoBfJHTYy

I think you're approaching this the right way: the web UI does use JMX 
to update the seeds file, either locally or to a remote engine, so what 
you want to do is definitely possible. I don't yet know what's going wrong.

Gerwin van Doorn wrote:
> Hi!
> 
> We are using Heritrix 2 as a crawler and would like to read and write
> the seed file of a job using JMX. We use the code from
> org.archive.webui.Seeds (.java, see below) but it does not work.
> 
> When calling long size = engine.getFileSize(job.encode(),            
>         SETTINGS_PATH); we get an error saying root:seeds:seedsfile
> doesnt exist.  Removing this line gives the error :
> 
> root:seeds:seedsFile is invalid because
> org.archive.modules.seeds.SeedModuleImpl does not define a key named
> seedsFile
> 
> when calling sheetManager.getFilePath(SETTINGS_PATH)...
> 
> Any hints on how to retrieve the seed file remotely using JMX?

Might the job name be wrong, or the job instance somehow mismatched with 
the job at the engine? (Can you perform any other job operations other 
than seed viewing/changing? Can you compare the job instance at this 
point in your code to a job instance in a working default Heritrix web UI?)

What is the 'state' of the job at the time you're trying to update the 
seeds?

Are you doing this via an alternate control panel/web UI, or some other 
custom code?

- Gordon @ IA
